intro: Cissampelos guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. The botanical features of Cissampelos guayaquilensis make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
